conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, and the view is angled with the ceiling/roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Clear wall extrusion with thickness, readable room volumes, and a consistent angled/isometric viewpoint. Cutaway is clean, though some interior edges/terminations feel simplified rather than fully architecturally resolved.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall massing roughly matches (large living zone left, kitchen/right, separate room top-right, central stair). However, several smaller plan-defined spaces/partitions (closets/WC/pantry subdivisions) appear missing or merged, reducing fidelity. Openings (doors/windows) are not reliably placed or dimensioned to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Basic furniture blocks and some kitchen cabinetry/counters are present, but dining setup and bathroom fixtures are not represented, and furniture does not strongly confirm all room identities from the 2D plan.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation with good contrast between walls and floor; lighting allows interior reading. Minimal artifacts and no label/UI clutter. Some ambiguity remains due to simplified openings and sparse fixtures.

detected_errors.description: Several small rooms/partitions present in the 2D plan (e.g., closet/WC/pantry subdivisions) appear omitted or merged in the 3D model, reducing layout fidelity.
Doors/windows are simplified and not clearly verifiable as being on the correct walls with correct sizes/orientations relative to the 2D plan.
Furniture/fixtures are incomplete (notably dining and bathroom), limiting confirmation of room functions and scale-by-use.

summary: A valid 3D cutaway conversion with good volumetric rendering, but only moderate plan fidelity due to missing/merged small spaces and simplified openings/fixtures.
